elements.title: Raorchestes chalazodes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Raorchestes chalazodes (example pictured) lays its eggs inside bamboo, and is the only species in its genus to exhibit parental care?

elements.title: Josephine Gates Kelly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Josephine Gates Kelly of the Standing Rock Reservation once hitchhiked to Washington, D.C., to protest portions of the Indian Reorganization Act?

elements.title: loss against the Parsis cricket team (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Vernon's loss against the Parsis cricket team was seen as "a blow to the prestige of the Empire"?

elements.title: Enoch Marvin Banks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Enoch Marvin Banks resigned from the University of Florida because of public outrage over his belief that the American Civil War was caused by slavery?

elements.title: Durham police mast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Durham police mast was designed to be slender to minimise the impact on views of Durham Cathedral?

elements.title: Arthur O. Austin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Arthur O. Austin built the most powerful outdoor high-voltage laboratory in the world?

elements.title: John Harrison Stonehouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that bookseller John Harrison Stonehouse commissioned the "cursed" edition of the Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam that was lost when the Titanic sank in 1912?

elements.title: Maha Thamun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Maha Thamun, the head of the Hanthawaddy delegation, presented his king's demands, King Thado of Ava reflexively ordered his execution?
